title: Lineup revealed for The Warehouse Project 2011
body:
This year’s Warehouse Project lineup was announced today.

As usual it boasts an eclectic mix of performances by some groundbreaking international artists. The beats break on Saturday 17th September and the former air raid shelter on Store Street will be reverberating with bass all the way up to New Years Day.

Voted the best club in the UK by dance music magazine Mixmag, The Warehouse Project’s first run of club nights were held in 2006 at a disused brewery in Strangeways. Since then the club has hosted some of the best musicians in the world, DJs such as Sven Väth, Pete Tong and Erick Morillo, and musicians such as De La Soul and the Happy Mondays. This year’s festivities will be the last to be hosted at the former air-raid shelter known as Store Street, a wild network of underground catacombs below Picadilly station.

I had the pleasure of visiting in 2009 when a then unknown Florence and The Machine got thrown off a makeshift stage, Broke ‘N’ English provided a perfect representation of Manchester life and Star Wars was screened in a low lit cavern complete with scantily clad girls serving popcorn. Seriously check it out.

The beats break on Saturday 17th September and the former air raid shelter on Store Street will be reverberating with bass all the way up to New Years Day.
excerpt.short: This year's Warehouse Project lineup was announced today.
